protocol_name: Preparation of Virus DNA from Seawater for Metagenomics
protocol_name_html: Preparation of Virus DNA from Seawater for Metagenomics

materials.reagent_name: Quant-iT dsDNA Pico Green assay kit (Invitrogen)
Amicon Ultra-15 Centrifugal Filter Unit with Ultracel-100 membrane

protocol_affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

sub_authors.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

authors_list.name: Matthew Sullivan Lab
authors_list.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

guidelines:
Needed:
  • 0.2 µm filtered seawater with iron chloride
  • Mg-EDTA-Ascorbate (Oxalate) buffer
  • DNase I
  • EDTA
  • EGTA
  • Centrifugal concentrators
  • Resuspension buffer
  • Wizard prep column
  • Wizard prep resin
  • Quant-iT dsDNA Pico Green assay kit

components.data: Precipitate 0.2µm filtered seawater with iron chloride and store the filters at 4°C
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Precipitate 0.2µm filtered seawater with iron chloride and store the filters at 4°C

components.data: Resuspend the precipitated virus in Mg-EDTA-Ascorbate (or Oxalate) buffer just prior to DNA extraction (also see Ferric Chloride Resuspension Buffer protocol)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend the precipitated virus in Mg-EDTA-Ascorbate (or Oxalate) buffer just prior to DNA extraction (also see Ferric Chloride Resuspension Buffer protocol)

components.data: Treat the resuspended virus preparation with DNase I for 2 hours at room temperature
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Treat the resuspended virus preparation with DNase I for 2 hours at room temperature

components.data: Inactivate the enzyme with EDTA and EGTA
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Inactivate the enzyme with EDTA and EGTA

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 4 of Preparation of Virus DNA from Seawater for Metagenomics
source_data.protocol_name: Preparation of Virus DNA from Seawater for Metagenomics
source_data.protocol_name_html: Preparation of Virus DNA from Seawater for Metagenomics
source_data.annotation: Previous work in the Tucson Marine Phage Lab has shown that it is not necessary to perform CsCl gradient centrifugation on the virus preparation prior to DNA extraction. The iron chloride precipitation followed by DNAse I treatment removes the majority of bacterial DNA that could contaminate the final metagenomic sequence. CsCl may be used, but for deep or other samples where viruses are limiting, the recovery of DNA may be significantly diminished by performing this step.
source_data.thread_text: Previous work in the Tucson Marine Phage Lab has shown that it is not necessary to perform CsCl gradient centrifugation on the virus preparation prior to DNA extraction. The iron chloride precipitation followed by DNAse I treatment removes the majority of bacterial DNA that could contaminate the final metagenomic sequence. CsCl may be used, but for deep or other samples where viruses are limiting, the recovery of DNA may be significantly diminished by performing this step.
source_data.body: Previous work in the Tucson Marine Phage Lab has shown that it is not necessary to perform CsCl gradient centrifugation on the virus preparation prior to DNA extraction. The iron chloride precipitation followed by DNAse I treatment removes the majority of bacterial DNA that could contaminate the final metagenomic sequence. CsCl may be used, but for deep or other samples where viruses are limiting, the recovery of DNA may be significantly diminished by performing this step.

components.data: Concentrate the resuspended virus preparation using centrifugal concentrators down to 3-5 ml total volume if performing CsCl cleanup or to 1-2 ml total volume if proceeding directly to DNA extraction
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Concentrate the resuspended virus preparation using centrifugal concentrators down to 3-5 ml total volume if performing CsCl cleanup or to 1-2 ml total volume if proceeding directly to DNA extraction

source_data.annotation: The Sullivan Lab recommends Amicon Ultra, 100kDa MWCO, either 15 ml or 5 ml capacity (Millipore UFC910024 or UFC810024), following manufacturer’s directions.
source_data.thread_text: The Sullivan Lab recommends Amicon Ultra, 100kDa MWCO, either 15 ml or 5 ml capacity (Millipore UFC910024 or UFC810024), following manufacturer’s directions.
source_data.body: The Sullivan Lab recommends Amicon Ultra, 100kDa MWCO, either 15 ml or 5 ml capacity (Millipore UFC910024 or UFC810024), following manufacturer’s directions.

source_data.reagent_name: Amicon Ultra-15 Centrifugal Filter Unit with Ultracel-100 membrane

components.data: Remove the concentrate to a fresh tube
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the concentrate to a fresh tube

components.data: Rinse the membrane with an additional 0.5-1 ml resuspension buffer by pipetting up and down along the membrane
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse the membrane with an additional 0.5-1 ml resuspension buffer by pipetting up and down along the membrane
This is a 0.05M Tris-Cl (pH 8.0), 0.01M EDTA resuspension buffer containing RNase A
source_data.protocol_affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University
source_data.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

authors_list.name: Qiagen

source_data.guidelines:
Storage condition - 4°C after adding RNase A.
Note: Buffer compositions are given per liter of solution. Buffer calculations are based on Tris Base adjusted to pH 8.0 with HCl (Tris-Cl).  Not recommended to be made with Tris-HCl due to acidity of solution (EDTA-Na2-2H2O needs a pH above 8.0 to dissolve), but if Tris-HCl is used, amount should be adjusted for correct molarity (0.05M) and NaOH should be used to bring pH up to 8.0.  This buffer may be autoclaved prior to addition of RNase A or it may be 0.2 μm filter-sterilized.

components.data: Dissolve 6.06g Tris Base in 800 mL MilliQ water
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dissolve 6.06g Tris Base in 800 mL MilliQ water

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Resuspension Buffer P1
source_data.annotation: Isn't this usually made from stock Tris and EDTA solutions?
source_data.thread_text: Isn't this usually made from stock Tris and EDTA solutions?
source_data.body: Isn't this usually made from stock Tris and EDTA solutions?

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Resuspension Buffer P1
source_data.annotation: It can be made either way depending on what you have available in the lab.  Some find it easier to use stock solutions, but it is not necessary as long as final pH is adjusted.
source_data.thread_text: It can be made either way depending on what you have available in the lab.  Some find it easier to use stock solutions, but it is not necessary as long as final pH is adjusted.
source_data.body: It can be made either way depending on what you have available in the lab.  Some find it easier to use stock solutions, but it is not necessary as long as final pH is adjusted.
source_data.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

components.data: Add 3.72g EDTA disodium salt, dihydrate to the 800 mL Tris base and stir to dissolve
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 3.72g EDTA disodium salt, dihydrate to the 800 mL Tris base and stir to dissolve

components.name: Section

components.data: Adjust the pH to 8.0 with HCl
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Adjust the pH to 8.0 with HCl

components.data: Protocol
components.name: Section

components.data: Adjust the volume to 1 liter with MilliQ water
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Adjust the volume to 1 liter with MilliQ water

components.data: Protocol
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 100mg RNase A per liter of buffer P1
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100mg RNase A per liter of buffer P1

components.data: Protocol
components.name: Section

components.data: Pool with the concentrated sample.
components.name: Description

components.data: At this point, either layer this onto premade CsCl gradients and isolate the virus fraction according to the protocol Cesium Chloride Purification of Viruses (or alternatively, Cesium Chloride DNA Extraction of Viruses using Wizard Prep Columns) or proceed directly to Wizard Prep purification of DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: At this point, either layer this onto premade CsCl gradients and isolate the virus fraction according to the protocol Cesium Chloride Purification of Viruses (or alternatively, Cesium Chloride DNA Extraction of Viruses using Wizard Prep Columns) or proceed directly to Wizard Prep purification of DNA.

components.data: Extract the DNA using Wizard Prep columns and resin
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Extract the DNA using Wizard Prep columns and resin

source_data.annotation: The community virus DNA is now ready for metagenomic library preparation or for linker amplification if more DNA is needed for sequencing (see Linker Amplification protocol and Bar-Coded Oligos for LA if needed).
